title: Name a champion and I'll tell you why they are unfun bullshit
body:
It's super popular to say "While x chanpion is overtuned, that's not the real problem. The real problem is that their kit is _toxic_, and _unfun_, and I don't like playing against them."
 
I'm not gonna argue that this never has any merit, hut I think every champion in the game has elements of their kit that feel like bullshit when they're strong, and usually the most bullshiitty-feeling part of their kit is a huge part of what makes them unique and fun to play.

So I challenge you to name any champion, and I will give you my honest, detailed, logical opinion about why it seems no-fair to play against them, strong or not.

Edit: Sorry for the gap in responses, my boss came to my desk and told me to get to work. Starting up again now.

Her w is a little more interesting. When it was stronger, it was strong enough to buoy up an entire toxic playstyle, in which the combination of cdr and tank stats made her unkillable. Right now, however, it's pretty balanced - for a point and click snare that prevents people from making use of bushes to avoid her. 

Her empowered e we already touched, but her unempowered one is still ridiculous. At level one, it gives 5% less movespeed than master Yi's ultimate does _at level 16_, but 15% more than what it gives him at level 6. _And it keeps going up_. And she can give this to any ally, on a relatively short cooldown, with a pretty sturdy shield attached, because keeping her adc safe from danger and blocking damage is her niche.

It's just so hard to kill an adc protected by karma, her mantra e means her team always has the positioning advantage, and her q does pretty respectable damage on top of that.

Actually, here's another, better metaphor.

Playing against Shyvana is a lot like fighting a Dragon Ball Z Villain. She pops up out of nowhere and starts causing trouble, so you try to fight her, but she's destroying you. So you team up with all your buddies and unleash all your special abilities that you have been saving for such an occasion, driving her back into a huge cloud of smoke.

You smirk in triumph, when she steps forth from the smoke, more or less unharmed, chuckling. She proceeds to transform and jump at you, tearing you to shreds. There's nothing you can do.

You beat her by just dying and training for a really long time, after which point she never does anything interesting ever again.

The fun part about playing shyvana is when you get to jump on people and they use everything at their disposal and still die.
The frustrating part about playing against shyvana is when she jumps on you and you use everything at your disposal and still die.

I don't remember the specifics, but there was the very quoteable description of her game plan which went something like "Shyvana just basically tries to farm up a bag of gold and hit you over the head with it".

Obviously some changes have been made since then, but they've mostly been about making her shittier at getting that bag of gold and not as able to hit you over the head with it, Shyvana has never really been properly balanced around having a normal power curve.

Either she's allowed to farm up a bag of gold, and she hits you over the head with it until you catch up to her, or she isn't allowed to, and she either days half way through her ulti dash or she becomes a tank without cc or meaningful durability.

Or, to make it simpler:

Things she's good at include doing a ton of damage and being unkillable when she's ahead of you, and being ahead of you.

Things she's bad at: everything when she isn't ahead of you.

When she fits the meta, and is allowed to play her game, you get to play against someone that's just always stronger than you, faster than you, and tankier than you.

Oh, and when she ulties she gets to do all of the above but in aoe.
{{champion:127}} I'm actually looking forward to this.

Midlane she seems pretty balanced except her powerful ranged waveclear, heavy cc, heavy damage, and crazy safety.

Toplane, on the other hand...She's a ranged top, with all that brings, but instead of being a normal ad ranged top, she's a mage, so she has aoe wave clear, which makes her even _more_ safe, and means she scales better into teamfights. 

Her Q is actually fairly short ranged, unless there's a minion wave present, and that never happens in the laning phase. It also has a high mana cost, so it's considered fair for it to have an incredibly low cooldown for a 0.7 ap ratio ability with a respectable slow to the primary target. 

If a melee champion ever actually closes onto her, she presses W and then they don't. Also she gets another free q onto them. Probably another while they back away. 

If she's facing Irelia, Renekton, or post six Akali or Kassadin, and pressing W does nothing but 70 / 110 / 150 / 190 / 230 (+ 40% AP) damage + 70 / 100 / 130 / 160 / 190 (+ 70% AP), she presses e, which is not only a ground targeted blink (really really strong for escaping) that can't be blocked or interrupted easily, but also benefits from Leblanc Syndrome thanks to the delay (which admittedly makes engaging harder for her). 

Leblanc Syndrome occurs when an ability, such as Leblanc W, or Ryze Ulti, or Lissandra E, has a delayed, targeted blink. The player of the champion insists that the delay makes the ability harder to use, and in some cases, they are right. However, when escaping an enemy without heavy cc or sticking power, the ability says "Pick a location: Either the place I have telegraphed I can blink, or the place I am now. You are only one enemy, you can only chose one location. Ok, picked it? Wrong!". The player of the Leblanc Syndrome champion gets to feel super tricky and clever, often crowing about "THE JUUUUUKES!!!" while only the enemy champion knows that there was no real choice all along and no way for them to win.

Anyway, back to Lissandra. At level 6, she gets to chose between a targeted Sejuani Ultimate that has damage scaling with her primary stat, or a Zhonya's with damage scaling with her primary stat and hp gain.. No, no, not like Kayne or Kha'zix gets to chose, not at all. No, she gets to chose each time the ultimate is up. Whichever one she chooses actually further aids her ability to not have to pay attention to melee champions in the laning phase. In teamfights, she's a huge damage and cc threat with short cooldowns, and powerful utility, which doesn't sound that op until you compare her to the shivering, underfarmed wreck of a melee top that is her counterpart on the enemy team.

2) That ult?  Yea that shit's range is massive.  If Urgot sees it he can shoot at it.  So if you're at 30%(Yeah it deals damage) and in vision range, you best be behind your tank because otherwise he will drag you in and use your ground-up corpse to feed starving children in Africa.

Alright, despite the memes there's a reason this guy was dumpstered by riot until they could rework his ugly mug.

His passive is %damage mitigation. You know, that thing that makes Phantom
Dancer so balanced? It's even better then that though, because rather than being straight damage mitigation, it reduces their damage to EVERYONE. Good luck fighting him at 85% strength. Beat part is, he can apply this to multiple people, gimping multiple carries. Also, he can do it with unavoidable autos, or a high speed 900 range skillshot on a miniscule cooldown. Do both at the same time, and spread the pain around.

His q means that, barring a minion wave or tank to hide behind, he will massively outrange and bully his enemy melee top laner. There's almost no cooldown on his missiles, so his primary damage is basically always up.

So maybe you're tired of getting poked down by his endless stream of missiles every 2 seconds, and want to all in him. His w crushes your hopes of doing so, allowing him to slow you with his missiles and autos, kiting like a god and hard punishing you for disengaging from any trade with him without a dash. Whats that, you needed to use your dash to get through all the slows? Sucks to be you! And when you finally reach him, he has this massive shield that scales with all the mana he's building to missile spam you EVEN HARDER, which you'll struggle to break through even without your damage being reduced by his passive.

So remember how I said his q can be countered by standing behind some poor sod? I was lying, his e allows those missiles to lock on and increasing their range to absurd distances, rendering his damage even more braindead than a right clicking adc. Besides the lock on, it also takes the liberty of stripping off some of the armour you've been building to survive the constant barrage of intercontinental rockets you're being barraged with. It also deals physical damage in ticks, allowing him to stack his black cleaver to full penetration at ludicrous speeds.

The cherry on top is his point and click cc that displaces you harder than a blitz hook, shile also giving him a bunch of defensive stats. Whats that, you were standing within a screen of an enemy tower? Enjoy the free tower shots along with enough missiles to make the USA jealous as he lands a guaranteed e, activates his w so you can't run, applies his passive so you can't kill him through the damage reduction, shields, and defensive steroids, and annihilates your health bar. Whats that? You stayed close to your support/tank so they could bail you out? Nah, they're too busy being cc'd by the fear Urgot has on his ult for SOME REASON.

But no, please tell me more about how the unassailable point and click tanky ranged dps machine tank killer is so hard done by.
